text:
Forgot to add a couple of other products making a presence in the MSP world…. 
Action1 (www.action1.com
)
has grown greatly over the past couple of years. They’re growing past just
patching but it’s still the root of the product for now. Mike Walters is here
on the list contributing monthly patch summaries. I’m sure he’s rocking in his
chair, “Pick me! Pick me!” Seriously, though, if we hadn’t hacked things
together just enough to work with our RMM’s patching system, Action1 would be at
the top of my list for review. 
Another one that’s popped up recently is SecOps Solution
(https://www.secopsolution.com/
). 
I know nothing about them. Just offering alternatives I’ve seen. 
Someone mentioned ManageEngine. I’ve not heard anything bad about their patching
solution. Unfortunately, I believe they’re another company that’s bought up
multiple products to build up their portfolio. Lots of their products have
CVEs. Lots. See my other post about business security concerns and management
of old code bases to understand why I’d be hesitant to use them.

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what?
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from mjudd@360smartnet.com. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Forgot to add a couple of other products making a presence in the MSP world…. 
Action1 (www.action1.com
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.action1.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cb5bec5068d354deb68e008dc28ae56ec%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638429976462733997%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=2QA5ggw2AIwxr2vAPjRwHPdVn6PXkkPfWfQnopIHf0Q%3D&reserved=0])
has grown greatly over the past couple of years.  They’re growing past just
patching but it’s still the root of the product for now.  Mike Walters is here
on the list contributing monthly patch summaries.  I’m sure he’s rocking in his
chair, “Pick me!  Pick me!”  😃 Seriously, though, if we hadn’t hacked things
together just enough to work with our RMM’s patching system, Action1 would be at
the top of my list for review. 
Another one that’s popped up recently is SecOps Solution
(https://www.secopsolution.com/
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.secopsolution.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cb5bec5068d354deb68e008dc28ae56ec%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638429976462743462%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QaQXRRGmS3R4s05924b%2F3hIpYvX5ZiPGz3IBL96pwzY%3D&reserved=0]). 
I know nothing about them.  Just offering alternatives I’ve seen. 
Someone mentioned ManageEngine. I’ve not heard anything bad about their patching
solution.  Unfortunately, I believe they’re another company that’s bought up
multiple products to build up their portfolio.  Lots of their products have
CVEs.  Lots.  See my other post about business security concerns and management
of old code bases to understand why I’d be hesitant to use them. 
From: Michael Judd
Sent: Thursday, February 8, 2024 8:28 AM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
NinjaOne is a full-blown RMM for managing workstations & servers, so patching is
just a subset of the product.  I have no hands-on experience.  It’s become a
favorite in the MSP world.  I know folks that work there.  They’re happy and
100% behind the company and product.  The company has been moving fast the past
couple of years to improve and add features. 
From: 'Erno, Cynthia M (ITS)' via PatchManagement
<patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 8, 2024 7:26 AM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
Batchpatch is always worth a look. 
I was looking at what manageengine had to offer and I spotted a competitor I’ve
not heard of before: NinjaOne. 
Anyone have any experience with that one? 
https://www.gartner.com/reviews/market/service-orchestration-and-automation-platforms/vendor/ninjaone/product/ninjaone/reviews?marketSeoName=service-orchestration-and-automation-platforms&vendorSeoName=ninjaone&productSeoName=ninjaone
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gartner.com%2Freviews%2Fmarket%2Fservice-orchestration-and-automation-platforms%2Fvendor%2Fninjaone%2Fproduct%2Fninjaone%2Freviews%3FmarketSeoName%3Dservice-orchestration-and-automation-platforms%26vendorSeoName%3Dninjaone%26productSeoName%3Dninjaone&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cb5bec5068d354deb68e008dc28ae56ec%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638429976462750618%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=l9C4iOfiwluxqvZlb98CCNp3SxChItTGgbTuvK151HA%3D&reserved=0] 
Cynthia Erno 
From: 'McLennan, Jason' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 8, 2024 5:36 AM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
ATTENTION: This email came from an external source. Do not open attachments or
click on links from unknown senders or unexpected emails. 
We’re looking into this now. Tanium wasn’t even on our list to evaluate so I’ll
add it 😊 
Didn’t really get on with Ivanti, the console just looked old and tired, and
they seem to have just bolted on some basic Linux stuff just so they could say
‘you can manage Linux as well’. 
We’ve had a few demos with ManageEngine Endpoint Central and that looks pretty
good, nice web GUI and some neat features. We’re trialling how it works across
multiple segregated domains at the moment and will probably go with that if it
works due to cost vs functionality. 
We only need it for servers, not clients. 
Classification: BUSINESS
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/IA2PR16MB64945F41827B4A4959935A91F4442%40IA2PR16MB6494.namprd16.prod.outlook.com
